intro: Loudetiopsis fulva, commonly known as the yellow stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is released when the leaves are damaged. Due to its adaptability and invasive tendencies, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
